description: Bowdler +‎ -ize; named after English physician Thomas Bowdler (1754–1825). In 1818 he published a censored version of William Shakespeare (The Family Shakespeare), expurgating “those words and expressions  […]  which cannot with propriety be read aloud in a family.”

verbs.description: bowdlerize (third-person singular simple present bowdlerizes, present participle bowdlerizing, simple past and past participle bowdlerized)

entries.meaning: To remove or alter those parts of a text considered offensive, vulgar, or otherwise unseemly.
examples: The bowdlerized version of the novel, while free of vulgarity, was also free of flavor.
